Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with two bands in added red; exterior, from top: two dilute lines at base of wall; in handle zone band of dotted concentric circles with, at right, handle frill pattern beside missing handle; single streaky band.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see British Museum 1888,0601.478.j. Although not mentioned by Lemos, the sherd ought to belong in her Group of Chalices with Dotted Concentric Circles because of the decoration around the handle zone and between the handles (Lemos 1991, 70).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 240, no. 201)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0109) (phase 2)
